body: ### Language server omnisharp ### Requested feature Omnisharp supports [dotnet-scripts](https://github.com/dotnet-script/dotnet-script) automatically. Those are ".csx" files with a shebang and a special syntax for dependencies. But neovim doesn't because the rootdir is not defined. Example (using Lunarvim distribution): Command: `:LspInfo` [dotnet-scripts](https://github.com/dotnet-script/dotnet-script) has a cli to scaffold a new script and this is the structure: ``` $ mkdir Hello $ cd Hello $ dotnet script init $ tree . ├── main.csx └── omnisharp.json 0 directories, 2 files ``` Note that a .csx script can be used in Azure Function (https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-functions/functions-reference-csharp?tabs=functionsv2) So, there is 3 options to find the root directory for scripts: 1. trying to find the file `omnisharp.json` The problem is that the `omnisharp.json` is required to have the lsp to work, but this file is not require to run the script. Example: [Azure Function doesn't have omnisharp.json](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-functions/functions-reference-csharp?tabs=functionsv2#folder-structure) 2. trying to find main.csx The problem is the file ".csx" could be named differently. Example: in [Azure Function](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-functions/functions-reference-csharp?tabs=functionsv2#folder-structure) 3. trying to find *.csx Problems could happen in a ./script folder for example with a lot of csx. in different folder. Script could loaded between them using the for example: `#load ../OtherScript.csx`. [Reference](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-functions/functions-reference-csharp?tabs=functionsv2#reusing-csx-code) I think the "safer" is to find for `omnisharp.json` for dotnet-script and `function.json` for Azure Function, because it has less chance to create side effects. I have linked a PR with those changes. ### Other clients which have this feature _No response_
title: Support for dotnet scripts
